article_title: Food labeling law doesn't fit all sizes, pizza industry says
article_text:
By Steve Tarter, GateHouse Media Illinois

Posted May 16, 2016 at 11:18 AM

Updated May 16, 2016 at 11:19 AM

article_metadata.description: Chain restaurants like McDonald's and Panera's are posting nutritional information along with prices on their menu boards.As part of a little-known aspect of the Affordable Care Act, the Food and Drug Administration is requiring food chains with 20 or more outlets to post labeling information such as how many calories will be consumed per serving.But it's a rule that pizza parlors across the country say doesn't fit with the business they do."We're not trying to get out of labeling," said Chris
article_metadata.author: Steve Tarter, GateHouse Media Illinois
